posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Greetings!

Here is my first try for a build. Now, I use the word "my", because it was my original question that led to this, not because I did it all myself. It was in very large part a collaboration of the great members of this excellent forum that resulted in this build. You can read the discussion here:
bard-3-fighter-8-arcane-archer-29-help- ... 8-s20.html

Anyway, the purpose of the build was to gain very high AB, so it could be used as a companion to a tank and deal out a large amount of damage per second, a so called DPS if you use that term. The build is somewhat adapted to Blackstone Keep, a PW where I play occasionally. It's a very high-magic world with some specific challenges, so if you play elsewhere, you might want to adapt the build somewhat.

Here are the details:
SpoilerFighter(10), Bard(3), Arcane Archer(27), Elf STR: 12 CON: 10 INT: 14 01: Fighter(1): Weapon Focus: Longbow, Point Blank Shot 03: Fighter(3): Weapon Focus: Rapier 05: Fighter(5) 07: Bard(1) 09: Arcane Archer(2): Improved Critical: Longbow 11: Arcane Archer(4) 13: Arcane Archer(5) 15: Arcane Archer(7): Improved Critical: Rapier 17: Arcane Archer(9) 19: Fighter(8): Called Shot 21: Arcane Archer(11): Epic Weapon Focus: Longbow 23: Fighter(10): Epic Weapon Specialization: Longbow 25: Bard(2) 27: Arcane Archer(15): Great Dexterity I, (DEX=27) 29: Arcane Archer(17) 31: Arcane Archer(19) 33: Arcane Archer(21): Great Dexterity IV, (DEX=32) 35: Arcane Archer(23) 37: Arcane Archer(25) 39: Arcane Archer(27): Great Dexterity VIII, (DEX=37) Skillpoints: 232 Saving Throw bonuses: Spells: +9, Mind Effects: +2 AB (max, naked): 45 (melee), 61 (ranged) Spell Casting: 02: Discipline(1), Save(15), 04: Discipline(1), Save(21), 06: Save(28), 08: Lore(4), Spot(2), 10: Spot(1), Save(8), 12: Discipline(7), Save(10), 14: Spot(1), Save(19), 16: Spot(1), Save(29), 18: Spot(1), Save(39), 20: Discipline(1), Save(40), 22: Spot(1), Save(48), 24: Spot(2), Save(53), 26: Lore(4), Spot(2), 28: Lore(1), Spot(1), Save(8), 30: Lore(1), Spot(1), Save(16), 32: Lore(1), Spot(1), Save(24), 34: Lore(1), Spot(1), Save(32), 36: Lore(1), Spot(1), Save(40), 38: Spot(1), Save(50), 40: Discipline(16), Perform(3), Spellcraft(15), Tumble(12), UMD(15),
As Valerfor suggested elsewhere, you can switch some feats around depending on taste and needs.

Equipped with Rapier and Shield for emergency melee, the survivability is fine, even on lower levels. Anyway, this is my first try and I'm not a powergamer, more of an Role Player, so you might need to check this out before using it.

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
CHA: 8
I see why you didn't invest more in Bard! I like the rapier addition, not losing any archery and gaining a viable melee option for low levels. I also like the trade of 1 enchant arrow level for both EWF and Bard skill dump, giving tumble and spellcraft.

Only thing I could say is in general mention the XP penalty you take with Bard / Elf as people will want  to take this build to other servers. Imp critical on rapier can probably be dropped for something else (like iron will?) as at a certain point you will never attack with one again, AA levels will just be better. Granted 83 AC with your shield out and +10 gear (with those monk shoes!) is not bad at all.

Basically you have near the best AB ever possible and great damage coming from fighter levels, with enough spare pre-epic feats for players to adapt how they need. I think this is my favorite "pure" AA split, more well rounded and lots of goodies for just 1 enchant arrow level.

Well done!
